correction.p: OCR generated transcript has not been corrected.

normalization.p: Only minor normalization where needed, if any, is indicated via markup.

punctuation.p: All punctuation marks in the source text have been retained, and are represented by appropriate Unicode code points.
Punctuation may be marked up with pc elements for clarification, but not exclusively.

quotation.p: All quotation marks have been retained, and are represented by appropriate Unicode code points.

hyphenation.p: Hyphenated words that appear at the end of a line have been retained. The hyphen, if present, is represented by the Unicode code point, and marked up with a pc element. The break="no" attribute on the lb element indicates that a single word is split across the lines.

interpretation.p: Dates, places, and names may be marked up, where useful.

body.ab:
[A transcription of this page is not available.]
[A transcription of this page is not available.]
Mr. & Mrs. J. R. Rapp
1211 Brook Drive
Wilmington, Delaware 19803
WILMINGTON, DE 198
PM
2 MAR
1982
Church of the Nativity
1099 Ocean Avenue
Brooklyn, N.Y. 11210
RETURNED TO SENDER
FORWARDING ORDER EXPIRED
1211 Brook Drive
Wilmington, Delaware 19803
March 1, 1982
Church of the Nativity
1099 Ocean Avenue
Brooklyn, N.Y 11210
Dear Sir:
My son is working on some genealogical research
on his family and I am writing to you to see if you can
furnish some inforaiation to us.
My family lived at 695 East 19th Street and I
attended your church during the years 1939 (the year of
my birth) until sometime during the mid 1950's. My
name before my marriage was Linda Marilyn Disosway.
I would appreciate it if you could forward
any information you might have on record, such as names,
addresses and any relevant dates concerning, either me or
my family. My father's name was Harry Flandreau Disosway
and my mother's name was Estelle (Stella) Disosway.
Thank you for any help you can give to us.
Sincerely,
Linda D. Rapp
2nd
Floor
695 E 19th
695 E 19th St
B’klyn
1st Floor
Linda
DEMAY
17 Roanoke Rd
Wellesley Mass
02181
BOSTON, MA 021 PM 9 DEC 1976
Mr. and Mrs. J. R. Rapp
1211 Brook Drive
Wilmington, Delaware.
19803
Dear Linda and Jim,
Merry Christmas!
I wish I had a trip planned
that would get me near
Wilmington, but maybe
next year.
I’ve been working right
through summer and fall,
but will go to Bermuda for
the holidays to see some
old friends who live
there.
Dad’s and Mom’s birthdays
are a mystery to me. Dad was
an only child of Harry
Hamilton Disosway and
— Disosway. They owned
Disosway’s Drugstore in
a then‐fashionable section
of Brooklyn. HHD’s family
came from New Bern and are
still there. That’s all I know
except that Dad worked with
Francis C. Carr & Company
at 80 Maiden Lane in N.Y.C.
As everyone in those days, he
worked a half day Saturday
morning. He met Mom in a
tea room in Brooklyn. He was
about 45 when they were married.
Do you remember the Christmas
and Thanksgiving dinners at our
house?
Ken
Linda
Jr.? in H.S. Katheryn & Elsa (lived together)
Katherine: relative of Linda's father
Elsa worked in Midwood H.S. as counselor
found jobs for Linda
Linda's employment
1. Handy & Assoc., after school, Jr. year (got out of school early)
2. Knickerbocker Press, during summer from Russel Sage
